NEWS 07/15 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 07/2015 Fassmer-Azubi gewinnt Preis Arbeitgeberverbandes Jessica Mollzahn, Auszubildende Industriekauffrau Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co. KG, 23.07.2015 „Kompass 2015 – Kurs Erfolg“, Auszubildenden-Preis Arbeitgeberverbandes Oldenburg für kreative, engagierte qualifizierte Auszubildende, gewonnen. Gesucht Auszubildende, Leistungen Betrieb Berufsschule zeigen, engagierte Mitarbeit Unternehmen außerberufliche Aktivitäten auszeichnen. Aus zahlreichen Bewerbungen 5 „Nominierte“ Preisverleihung 23.07.2015 Oldenburg eingeladen, Jessica Mollzahn, Auszubildende 2. Ausbildungsjahr. Aufgrund erfolgreichen sportlichen Engagements Kunstradsportlerin Trainerin Nachwuchssportlern Wohnort Neuenkirchen aufgrund positiven Einsatzes Unternehmen (z.B. Unterstützung Organisation Spendentombola, Mitglied Jugend- Auszubildendenvertretung) Berufsschule (freiwilliger Besuch Zusatz-Unterrichts, parallel Ausbildung Fachhochschulreife erwerben) schlug Fassmer für Kompass 2015 vor. Die Freude groß, Jessica Mollzahn Herrn Lehmann, Hauptgeschäftsführer AGV Oldenburg, Gewinnerin genannt wurde. Neben Herrn Waskönig, Vorsitzenden geschäftsführenden Vorstands AGV Oldenburg, gratulierte Fassmer-Geschäftsführer Holger Fassmer Namen gesamten Fassmer-Teams herzlich schönen Anerkennung, Preisgeld 1.000,- € verbunden ist.

NEWS 06/15 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 06/2015 Neuer 28-Meter-Seenotkreuzer getauft Zur Taufe SK 35 Tochterboot TB 39 DGzRS zahlreiche Gäste Tausende Freunden Förderern Seenotretter nah fern begrüßt. Karin Fahrenschon, Ehefrau Georg Fahrenschon, Präsident Deutschen Sparkassen- Giroverbandes, Hauptsponsor Jubiläumsveranstaltungen DGzRS, taufte Seenotkreuzer Namen ERNST MEIER-HEDDE. Sie wünschte „allzeit Fahrt Besatzung stets sichere Heimkehr“. Das Tochterboot Nicole Keller, Enkelin Meier-Heddes, Namen Großmutter Meier-Heddes Ehefrau LOTTE getauft. Für musikalischen Rahmen sorgten Musiker Bundespolizeiorchesters Hannover. Die ERNST MEIER-HEDDE Typschiff völlig 28-Meter-Klasse. Die jüngste modernste Bootsklasse DGzRS konzipiert leistungsfähiger Nachfolgetyp 27,5-Meter-Seenotrettungskreuzer, 1985 1992 Dienst gestellt wurden. Die Einheit löst Zuge Modernisierung Rettungsflotte Seenotrettungskreuzer VORMANN LEISS (Baujahr 1985) Station Amrum ab. Erste Probefahrten stattgefunden positive Ergebnisse gebracht. Vor endgültigen Stationierung Neubau umfangreiche Erprobungen absolvieren. Das 24 Knoten (ca. 46 km/h) schnelle Schiff Mann starken Besatzung gefahren. Besondere Merkmale umfassende Ausrüstung medizinischen Erstversorgung Bord, Feuerlöschpumpe ferngelenktem Monitor Bekämpfung Bränden See Fähigkeit, Falle Durchkenterns innerhalb Sekunden aufzurichten. In für Seenotrettungskreuzer typischen Heckwanne führen 28-Meter-Einheiten jeweils Meter langes Tochterboot sich. Der Reeder Meier-Hedde (1913-1994), Mitbegründer Bremer Schlüssel-Reederei für Massengutschiffe, 1980 1990 Jahre ehrenamtlicher Vorsitzer Seenotretter. Sein Engagement bestimmt Bestreben, Seenotrettern stets Höchstmaß Sicherheit Bord geben – wichtigste Voraussetzung für erfolgreichen Einsatz See. Seine Beruf gewonnenen Erfahrungen stellte voll Dienst DGzRS. Durch vorbildliches Wirken, menschliche Haltung Dienst humanitären Aufgabe Fachwissen prägte Bild DGzRS In- Ausland nachhaltig. Mit Namengebung würdigt DGzRS indirekt Jubiläum Jahres 2015: Vor 25 Jahren, Vorsitz Meier-Hedde, kehrte Gesellschaft angestammten Stationen Mecklenburg-Vorpommern zurück. Die Wiedervereinigung Seenotretter Ost West Höhepunkt Tätigkeit. Die Eckdaten Klasse: Länge über Alles: 27,90 Meter Breite über Alles: 6,2 Meter Tiefgang: 2,00 Meter Geschwindigkeit: 24 Knoten (ca. 45 km/h) Besatzung: 9/4 Pers. (Stamm/Einsatz) Antrieb: Propeller, 1.440 kW/1.958 PS = 2.880 kW/3.916 PS Verdrängung: 120 Tonnen Quelle Informationen: DGzRS/Die Seenotretter

Philosophy - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Research and Development Philosophy Construction and Consultation Idea to Series Product Optimization Customers and synergies We are committed to single aim: to provide the best result for our customers. That is why the only reasonable production approach is to work together with our customers, to know precisely their requirements and wishes – and then try to find the best solution. For the innovative market of FRP Products we can learn lot from nature. So it is not only important to observe optimal functioning systems and composites nature but the principles for construction as well. Fassmer is ahead of the competition, not only because of all these features but because of all the synergies within the company – that is really strong bond of competence!

Methods of Production - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company DE Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Composite Technology Caravan Panelling Automotive Amusement and Rides Industry Technologies Methods of Production Hand lay-up Technique Vacuum Infusion RTM Press Moulding CNC Materials Tool Making Automation Research and Development Set standards for innovative solutions Fassmer is expert the entire spectrum of technologies used manufacturing components and assemblies made of composite materials, from hand lay-up through to Resin Transfer Moulding (RTM) processes and vacuum infusion technique of even very large GRP components (plus cold press moulding the field of composite technology). In co-operation with its customers, Fassmer selects the best combination of moulding and production techniques which are best suited for each particular component. The production method chosen always depends on several aspects: geometry of the parts strengths and wall thickness requested weight general requirements of the parts quantity of series components

Additionally, the use of FRP gives designers lot of freedom. That is especially important if it is impossible to use other materials. At Fassmer’s, we offer one-stop service depending on your wishes: Product development and beautification Plugs, moulds, forms and additional services, e.g. varnish Finished components Diverse possibilities, and endless variety of forms Apart from producing new components, Fassmer offers FRP repair, renovation and preparation worldwide. As Fassmer has specialized this high-tech sector, the FRP application area is accordingly manifold and flexible. Spinners and Nacelles - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Spinners and Nacelles Producing spinner and nacelle covers has long tradition at Fassmer, which has always used materials of high quality, strength, corrosion resistance and very low weight, not only FRP (Fibre Reinforced Plastics) but aluminium. As one of the European leaders , Fassmer offers optimized production processes and guarantees maximum economy and quality. Within the windpower business Fassmer has been supplying various turbine manufacturers for more than 15 years (e.g. REpower, Enercon, GE Wind and many others). Fassmer is complete system supplier. In addition to manufacturing components, we integrate fittings, bolt-on units, weather stations and complete hydraulic and electrical assemblies. This approach eliminates interfacing problems. You benefit from having just one contact partner right through from development to after-sales service.

onshore & offshore Windpower - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Competence for Wind-powered Solutions The operating goals of Fassmer are top quality and customer satisfaction . An expert in-house design and engineering team backed up by modern production facilities provides Fassmer with exceptional capacity for innovation and ingenious technical solutions wind power. Fassmer's clients can take advantage of synergies between its six business areas: Shipbuilding, Lifeboats, Deck Equipment, Composite Technology, Wind Power and After-Sales Service. So the innovative market of wind power customers can profit from cumulative competence and state-of-the-art production facilities . A wide range of products convinces Fassmer's clients — beginning with the FRP- and aluminium components for spinners and nacelles, continuing to whole systems with all required equipment and last but not least the offshore components with boat launching systems, helicopter winching areas and service boats for offshore wind parks.

Survival Cells - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Helicopter Winching Area Windlift Survival Cells Service Boats Technologies Research and Development Survival Cells This custom-made cabin is constructed to provide life support or overnight stays for service personal or castaways . It is self-supporting modular unit that can be positioned to suit different tower dimensions. Fassmer has developed very comfortable survival cell with different features. Thermal insulation Independent ventilation/ heating systems Accommodation for three persons for 2-3 days Sanitary block Tower docking devices Railing system All equipment and fitments can be added and dimensions can be changed according to customers‘ wishes.

Windlift - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Helicopter Winching Area Windlift Survival Cells Service Boats Technologies Research and Development Windlift This is really ingenious invention. Service ships for offshore wind turbines can approach and dock from any direction, even bad weather situations. The height-adjustable windlift completely eliminates the need for climbing ladders , which can be very risky rough seas. As soon as the technicians and their equipment are on the platform the windlift is raised to elevated position. It can carry loads of up to 6 metric tonnes . The Fassmer Windlift is made entirely of seawater-resistant aluminium and needs no maintenance. The system can be tailored around different kinds of foundations/ transmission pieces and towers – always according the customer’s requirements. For most of its lifetime the windlift offshore wind turbine be kept out of the highly demanding splash water zone. Equipped with four landing sides the system guarantees safe landing according to wind, sea conditions and flow conditions. This concept offers numerous advantages compared with conventional systems: Accessibility of the wind turbine up to +/-2 significant wave height Docking from diverse directions (important during different wind, sea and flow conditions)) Possibility of crossing from the side to the bow In its resting position high above the sea level the wind lift is protected against wind and waves. Above all this means there is no plant cover and the lift has no increase of resistance when diving into the sea. Safe transfer to the platform (parallel to the boat, like the pilot´s crossing) without dangerous climbing when boarding A wind lift not only increases the availability of the wind turbines but improves the maintenance processes and reduces operational costs . But first and foremost the security of service employees is dramatically increased.

Helicopter Winching Area - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Helicopter Winching Area Windlift Survival Cells Service Boats Technologies Research and Development Helicopter Winching Area Fassmer produces helicopter winching areas suitable for offshore and inshore wind turbines. They are made from totally corrosion-resistant FRP materials or aluminium . This platform functions as safe working area for service technicians and materials after having been heli-lifted on. Opening platform grid gives safe access to the hatch which leads to the turbine. The platform can be used for winch rescues of injured persons. This system is compatible with: Emergency lowering points for descent systems Helicopter guides, lights/balls Hoisting davits for spare parts Wind measuring instruments

onshore & offshore Windpower - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Wind Power Spinners and Nacelles Offshore Service Solutions Technologies Research and Development Competence for Wind-powered Solutions The operating goals of Fassmer are top quality and customer satisfaction . An expert in-house design and engineering team backed up by modern production facilities provides Fassmer with exceptional capacity for innovation and ingenious technical solutions wind power. Fassmer's clients can take advantage of synergies between its six business areas: Shipbuilding, Lifeboats, Deck Equipment, Composite Technology, Wind Power and After-Sales Service. So the innovative market of wind power customers can profit from cumulative competence and state-of-the-art production facilities . A wide range of products convinces Fassmer's clients — beginning with the FRP- and aluminium components for spinners and nacelles, continuing to whole systems with all required equipment and last but not least the offshore components with boat launching systems, helicopter winching areas and service boats for offshore wind parks.

Slewing Arm Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Slewing Arm Rescue Davit (FSAR) and Slewing Arm Rescue and Raft Davit (FSARR) This Fassmer davit is suitable for rescue boats up to 21 kN launching weight and for liferafts for up to 25 persons. The slewing of the davit is effected hydraulically, as required by the IMO/ Solas. The winch is power operated for hoisting and is lowered by gravity. The system can be turned out, lowered, recovered and turned with the crew on board either from deck position or inside the boat. The FSARR davit employs the same principle, but can be used to operate liferafts.

Outrigger Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Outrigger Davit The Fassmer outrigger davit is designed for compact stowing, easy launching and recovery of Fassmer fully-enclosed lifeboats . It is supplied with electric/hydraulic powered winch with hydraulic brake system and double hydraulic wind system. For tanker or platform installation version with explosion proof is available for rescue boats (FSAR) and combined vessels (FSARR).

Hydraulic Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Hydraulic Davit The Fassmer hydraulic davit is perfect combination of gravity supported by hydraulic operation . The hydraulic cylinder pushes the davit arms as long as gravity permits. The hydraulic operation avoids complicated operation with any kind of bowsing gear as the cylinder holds the boat tightly to the ship structure for easy and safe embarkation . The combination of gravity and hydraulic allows for installation off the limit of pure gravity operation.

Freefall Pivots - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Freefall Hydraulic Pivot The Fassmer freefall hydraulic davit is high-performance deck-mounted system with deck or under-deck hydraulics for Fassmer freefall lifeboats between 55 and 75 kN. Hydraulic recovery with the crew on board is possible. Stainless steel shafts are used to reduce maintenance to minimum. For all sizes simulated launch device is available. This device enables the crew to perform drop without releasing the freefall all the way down into the water.

Multi-pivot Davits - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Pivot Davits Multi-pivot Davits Freefall Pivots Hydraulic Davits Outrigger Davits Slewing Arm Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Multi-pivot Davit The Fassmer multi-pivot davit is optimised pivot davit as regards installation height. This davit has additional pivot point to reduce the overall height. Embarkation is possible stowed position or when the vessel browsing gear is operation. The Fassmer multi-pivot davit ensures compact execution when installed within limited space. The turning-out of the manned craft and the lowering of the fully loaded craft are controlled by gravity. All davits are made of premium materials to ensure maximum lifetime with minimum of maintenance activities and spare parts. In combination with the Fassmer Duplex Release Hook System the entire launching process can be supervised by single person which provides maximum of safety.

History - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Capacities Global Contact Net History Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs A story of success In 1850 Johannes Fassmer set up his own business with plenty of shipbuilding competence, energy and perseverance. The company business those early years focused on small wooden boats and life-boats. Today Holger and Harald Fassmer lead company with more than 900 employees the fifth generation and have gained excellent national and international reputation.

Responsibility - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Being respectful and social Fassmer acts according to strict values concerning high quality, sustainability, environmental and social responsibility. All our employees are committed to provide the best products for our customers. We not only demand lot from our employees; we offer them lot, too. We are aware that we have high responsibility for their social welfare, their security and their health. So we work constantly to improve the working conditions and care for our staff’s health. Within our company transparency and communication are very important. We further these features our working processes. Employees are expected to treat each other respectful manner at all times. We respect our employees, with all their strengths and weaknesses. We take our environmental responsibility seriously and constantly work to improve our waste management, for example. We use sustainable long-lasting materials.

Locations - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Competence around the world The headquarters of the Fassmer Group is the Fassmer GmbH & Co. KG site Berne, Germany, on the River Weser. Located directly beside the river, the company site houses the administration offices, our development and design department and production workshops for all five product divisions – Shipbuilding, Lifeboats, Deck Equipment, Wind Power and Composite Technology. The main offices of our service subsidiary Fassmer Service GmbH & Co. KG are on this site; Fassmer Service America LLC is located Miami, our service-company Fassmer Singapore Pte.Ltd. Singapore Another member of the group, Fassmer Schiffsservice GmbH & Co. KG , founded 1996, operates from Rechlin, Germany. This company designs and builds components for our deck equipment division. Markos sp.z.o.o. Globino, Poland, is joint venture with Polish partner. In modern production halls, we manufacture fibre composite components for lifeboats, wind turbines, yachts and power boats. Fassmer-Marland Guangzhou, China, is joint venture set up 2005. The newly built and equipped office and production facilities are focused on the production of lifeboats, davits and boarding systems, primarily for the Asian market. Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co. Winches - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Fassmer Winches Fassmer provides winches of different sizes and different operational purposes . Fassmer winches are designed in-house to ensure best operational results combination with the chosen davit. Small winches for rescue boat operations or winches to operate XXL tender boats up to 45 tonnes are available as friction brake solution or with hydraulic brake system . All winches are electrically driven and fully approved according to the SOLAS / LSA Code.

Gangways - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Deck Equipment Boarding Systems Davits Gangways Working rafts-/ baskets Bulwark ladder and swivel platforms Winches After-Sales Service Global Service Net Standard Products Gangway Fassmer gangways are made of seawater-resistant aluminium and are suitable for merchant and passenger sea ships and pier-jetty-arrangements. All product variations comply with the regulations of international classification societies. The gangways vary length from 2 to 20 and can be from 2.000 to 600 mm wide. Their working range extends from -30° to 30° relation to the horizontal line. GRP-built gangways This is extraordinary example of the company’s innovative potential and effective use of internal synergies. This gangway forms part of the standard product line for boarding systems, and its product features are worth mentioning. The gangway shown at the right measures 3m length and built for installation on cruise vessel. The advantages of the material combination of glass-fibre-reinforced-plastic and aluminum are its straight and non-skid surface and its light weight. The geometry of the gangway is modified to follow the individual requirements of each vessel. Various types are available, and different widths and lengths can be produced on demand. Working raft Made of seawater-resistant aluminium, this working raft complies with the regulations of international classification societies. This product is available with outboard motor. Please refer to the below table to compare the two standard product variations available: Type A Length & width: 2.20m 2.30m Height: 1.25m Weight: 160kg Capacity: one person Type B Length & Width: 2.20m 3.30m Height: 1.25m Weight: 195kg Capacity: two persons Working basket This working basket is built to carry maximum of 3 persons. It is made of seawater-resistant aluminium. One of its sides is equipped with special treads to permit crew to enter. If required, it can be delivered with door. Bulwark ladder Made of seawater-resistant aluminium, the Fassmer bulwark ladder comes with plug-in pipe railing on both sides and head plate for attachment to the bulwark profile or tube. The possible heights of the bulwark can vary from 0.90m to 1.50m; the width between the side profiles measures 760mm. If required, the product can be adapted to fit other dimensions as well. Swivel platform Made of seawater-resistant aluminium or hot dipped galvanized steel. The platform can be turned to maximum of 180°and folded to maximum of 9°.

They are fast, unsinkable and self-righting lifesavers. This is the boat yacht owners have waited for! The SEL-RT 8.5 is built beautiful and exclusive double shell design . It never loses its buoyancy, not even the unlikely case of complete flooding. For its main purpose as partially enclosed lifeboat it is able to carry up to 40 persons and case of emergency three person-crew can rescue up to 6 persons very fast. As yacht tender up to 20 persons enter the comfortable watertight passenger seating area through large door. The boat is equipped with intelligent hoisting hooks which open on their own when the tender reaches the water. The SEL-RT 8.5 is according to SOLAS standards. Fassmer Service - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service A fully integrated process at Fassmer At Fassmer clients can rely on highly sophisticated and fully integrated process ranging from high-level consultations, research and design to perfect after-sales service including logistic and technical support, training and know-how transfer. Research Fassmer enjoys excellent reputation for innovation the maritime sector . We constantly examine and improve the operational behaviour and performance of our customer-specific designed products. Design In view of the large number of tailor-made vessels we produce, our experienced in-house design department plays major role at Fassmer. We can offer our customers the best possible support all aspects and all phases of project – from the first layout plan, basic and detailed design up to plant maintenance systems. Production Modern production facilities and highly skilled workforce are the prerequisites for the famous Fassmer quality backed up by on-time delivery. Based on long tradition that started 1850 we have always done our utmost to ensure our customers’ complete satisfaction every respect! After-Sales Service Given that you may expect lifetime of well over 30 years for Fassmer vessel, it goes without saying that you can rely equally on our after-sales service. We can ensure the availability of our vessels by offering: A worldwide service network that ensures the safe and reliable operation of your vessels Plant maintenance systems Crew training Delivery of spare parts and tools Technical support all aspects Technical co-operation If customer is interested one of our well-proven vessels but prefers construction on shipyard his own country, Fassmer is the right partner to choose. For such technical co-operation we provide wide range of services such as: Transfer of shipbuilding expertise Well-proven designs within extensive product range Tailor-made basic and detailed designs Assigned project managers and engineers to provide professional assistance at any level Logistic support to ensure smooth production Effective training programmes Material packages up to prefabricated shipbuilding kits Repairs and Conversions Fassmer offers all kinds of repairs and conversions. Our customers appreciate our modern ship lift which complies with the latest environmental requirements, as well as our heated workshops.

Company - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Jobs Fassmer – synergy of expertise and passion Fassmer is dynamic family-owned shipyard its fifth generation. The internationally successful company is active six business areas: Shipbuilding, Lifeboats, Deck Equipment, Wind Power, Composite Technology and After-Sales Service. Our clients appreciate the close cooperation with research institutes, innovative in-house design and engineering, modern production facilities and worldwide service network . We are one team Each step within the construction and production process demands maximum performance. This can only be reached with highly qualified employees and regular training sessions . More than 900 people work for Fassmer worldwide, half of them Germany. Their expert knowledge and motivated attitude to their work reflecting the duties they fulfill represent the company’s great potential! Benefit from other business areas. Convincing synergy-effects between the six business areas are great advantage for the company. The client profits from the cumulative expertise!

The patrol boats were designed to achieve maximum speed of 34 knots . The modern hull design permits excellent seagoing characteristics even at high speeds. In order to arrive at local cost-saving construction Fassmer cooperated with local shipyards. In such cases we always offer shipyard and crew training, design packages, technology transfer, technical documentation, material packages and supervision. 40 Standard Patrol Vessel - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Special Operation Boats Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service 40 Standard Patrol Vessel (FPV 40) Fassmer designed new 40-metre standard patrol vessel for the Danish Navy . The new patrol boats have the following main features: search and rescue operations, pick up and transport of multi-flex containers, fire fighting monitoring with capacity of 2.000 l/min. A modern hull design with favourable seakeeping and manoeuvrability basic requirement for the Danish Navy. 40 Coastal Patrol Vessel - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Special Operation Boats Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service 40 Coastal Patrol Vessel (CPV 40) This Fassmer 40-m coastal patrol vessel is sophisticated modern vessel serving wide range of tasks offshore. In order to fulfil its coastguard mission the CPV 40 is equipped with automatic identification system (AIS) as required by SOLAS chapter V for civilian shipping. Additional sensors, the navigation and 2D surveillance radar, the communication and radar ESM are installed to guarantee the fishery protection mission of the vessel. The CPV 40 is made for search and rescue missions including rescuing, fire fighting and emergency repairs – and, last not least, it is support and training vessel as well. Really powerful allrounder! Technical Data as PDF file for download Customer/Operator: Armada Nacional de Colombia Area of Operation: Caribbean Sea / Pacific Ocean Hull No.: 5000 Delivery: 2011

The risk of severe accident has been reduced to minimum. The bulkhead division of the ferry is such that two adjacent compartments loaded condition can be damaged without dangerous loss of buoyancy. They feature self-righting construction and well-protected passenger compartment that can accommodate up to six pilots. Good seagoing characteristics and optimum manoeuvrability make it easier to dock with moving vessels. Last not least jump platform and rescue equipment make these boats perfect for their special purpose. 16 Surveying Catamaran - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service 16 Surveying Catamaran (SCAT 16) This high-speed 16-metre catamaran is unique the history of German coastal authorities . The concept is based upon research project carried out by the German Ministry for Research and Technology which Fassmer closely involved. All flat components like bridge, ventilator housings etc. were made of seawater-resistant aluminium, and all curved elements, such as the hulls, of FRP. The catamaran is built according to modular concept that can be used for vessels of different lengths. Technical Data as PDF file for download Customer/Operator: German Harbour Authority Hamburg Area of Operation: River Elbe, Coastal Waters Hull No.: 1360 Delivery: 1994 Ship's name: NIEDERELBE

18 Sounding Catamaran - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service 18 Sounding Catamaran (SCAT 18) This 18-m sounding catamaran has been designed to operate coastal areas and inland waterways . A modern multi-channel echo sounding system, allows precise measurements. With two hydraulically operated sounding arms the complete sounding width covers 15 metres. The special catamaran design reduces ship movements and permits excellent course stability and manoeuvrability. 21 Research Vessel (FS 21) - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Shipbuilding SAR-/ Patrol Vessels Offshore Survey-/ Research Ships Offshore Support- / Service Vessels Work Vessels and Pilot Boats Yachts Ferries Naval Vessels Research, Design and Production Fassmer Service Foto: Florian Lange, Alfred-Wegener-Institut 21 Research Vessel (FS 21) The Alfred-Wegener-Institut für Polar-und Meeresforschung and the Fassmer company signed contract on 21m research vessel to be employed the wadden sea. This vessel with length of about 21 m, moulded beam of 6 and maximum speed of 10kn, is already the fifth research vessel to be built on the Fassmer shipyard. The design is based on our vessel type “BL21”. Due to its robust design, its flat hull and its professional research equipment it can easily be operated shallow waters and it offers best working conditions for the crew and scientists on board. In order to reduce the environmental pollution to minimum the vessel be built according to the latest “green” standards (“Green Passport” / “Blue Angel ship design”). Technical Data as PDF file for download Customer/Operator: Alfred-Wegener-Institut für Polar Meeresforschung Area of Operation: RSA 50 Hull No.: 5060 Delivery: 2013 Ship's name: MYA II

PRESS RELEASE 02/09 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs Press Release 02/09 Fassmer delivers new search and rescue cruiser to German life-saving organization „Deutsche Gesellschaft Rettung Schiffsbrüchiger“ (DGzRS). On January 6, 2009, company Fr. Fassmer handed over the first of two 19.9 long search and rescue cruisers to the Deutsche Gesellschaft Rettung Schiffsbrüchiger. The name of the new search and rescue cruiser is “EISWETTE”. This name chosen by the life-savers to honour the traditional and generous commitment of the Bremer Eiswett-Genossen and their guests, who donate money to the DGzRS on occasion of their annual foundation party. This custom is practiced since 1828/29. Britta Braun, wife of the President of the Eiswett-Genossen, crashed the traditional bottle of champagne on the shell of the new search and rescue cruiser, and wished the crew „always good cruising and safe return!“. Dr. Julie Smidt, wife of this year’s speaker of the Eiswette novices, christened the daughter boat on the name of NOVIZE. This special ship, of 19.90 length and with 38 to displacement, passed extensive test program over the last weeks the North Sea, sometimes very bad weather and heavy sea conditions. This special ship, the first of new class, has 1660 PS and makes 22 knots (approx. 40 km/h). It be used on the Station Nordstrand (in the German region of Schleswig-Holstein). In 2006, Fassmer contracted for construction and production of 2 search and rescue cruisers of that type. The second new vessel put into operation at the end of January 2009. The search and rescue cruiser is sailed by crew of three. The requirements to the new cruiser are mainly close-to-coast operation, but rather shallow waters. With draught of only 1.30 meters, the EISWETTE can be shipped areas where bigger search and rescue cruisers depend on their daughter boats. Of course, EISWETTE maintains the highest safety levels, even under extreme weather conditions open sea, as all units the rescue fleet do. Fassmer choose design without accommodation deck which the past used to be built on board of search and rescue cruisers. The crew is not housed on board, but the station building on the island. The search and rescue cruiser can be staffed very quickly, and sail out on its mission. Other special features of this ship type are the well-proven net frame structure, the workplace ergonomic design and the extensive medical equipment for first aid on board. A fire-fighting pump with capacity of 2,300 l/min can be used case of fire on sea. The electronic on-board network via data bus system is another novelty. This special lines system serves for transfer of data and energy between control elements and electric systems, as applied for instance computers but airplanes, and more and more frequently complex machines and modern automobiles. This increases the security of operations and saves lot of weight. The open work boat type the stern ramp is new. With the new “service boat” NOVIZE, which makes 37 knots (approx. 68 km/h), the EISWETTE still has powerful boat to assist missions, and to go shallow waters. A proven design chosen for the hull of the new search and rescue cruiser. By optimizing the lines the yard realized excellent seaworthiness. The main engine is widely free of auxiliary aggregates, and virtually available exclusively for driving the high-resilient carbon fibre propeller. This improves the manoeuvring characteristics and especially the operational safety. The sophisticated hydraulic system always provides enough energy normal operations for the electronic on-board network, the fire-fighting pump, or the bow thruster. When the main engine fails, there is hydraulic stand-by drive to bring the search and rescue cruiser safely out of the hazardous area, and back to the safe harbour. Of course, this new vessel type is designed as self-righting case of capsizing, as all search and rescue cruisers are. Company Fr. Fassmer carried out very elaborate capsizing test with the almost finished ship the presence of the DGzRS. The tests verified the calculations of the yard. The hull which had been keel-up water, righted itself one time. Technical Data of the 19.90 search and rescue cruiser “EISWETTE“ Main dimensions Overall length: 19.90 Overall width: 4.75 Draught: 1.30 Displacement: 39.30 Classification: GL+100 A5 OC4 „Rescue Vessel“ Performance Max. Speed: 22 Kn Range: Approx. 400 nm / 22 kn Load Fuel: 6000 Fresh water: 250 Crew: 3 Persons Material Rump: Aluminium Structures: Aluminium Drive / Stand-by engine Main drive: Caterpillar C32. 1232 kW Gear: 2-speed Reintjes gear. ZWVS 440 Propeller: 5-blade carbon fibre propeller; AIR Bow light(s): Type 460, 7.5 kN

PRESS RELEASE 07/09 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs PRESS RELEASE 07/09 GREENPEACE ORDERS TECHNOLOGICALLY-ADVANCED RAINBOW WARRIOR III. Greenpeace International Executive Director Gerd Leipold, today signed contract with the Fassmer Shipyard for construction of the Rainbow Warrior III. The sailing ship, which is to be completed time for Greenpeace's 40th anniversary 2011, include the very latest green technology making it ideal for use Greenpeace's campaign to avert catastrophic climate change. This is the first time the environmental organisation's history that it has chosen to commission purpose-built ship instead of refurbishing older one. The organisation maintains that even these difficult financial times, environmental protection must remain the international community's single greatest priority. 'Greenpeace is demanding that politicians and individuals alike to make policy and investment decisions based upon environmental imperatives. Just as this is the right thing for them to do, it is the right thing for Greenpeace, too. Now it is not the time to short change future generations,” Leipold explained. The Rainbow Warrior III be built primarily to sail (thus using wind energy instead of fossil fuels), with the option unsuitable weather conditions to switch over to enginepowered, diesel-electric propulsion. The A-frame design of the mast and the positioning of the sails have been optimised for efficiency and the shape of the hull has been designed for maximum fuel conservation. Heat created by the generators be re-used to heat water on board and for engine pre-heating. 'The Rainbow Warrior II has been great ship, with proud record of effecting environmental change, but even great warriors need to be retired' Leipold said at the contract signing ceremony. 'The Rainbow Warrior is synonymous with Greenpeace, with taking stand to defend the planet, and is icon of hope world wide. Not only does it provide Greenpeace with platform to challenge environmental abuse across the world, it provides people with inspiration to take action of their own. More than ever the world needs the hope and inspiration provided by the Rainbow Warrior.” Technical specifications vessel Rainbow Warrior III Main dimensions Length over all: 57,92 Beam (Max.): 11,30 Design Draft: 5,00 Air draught: 50,50 Tonnage: Approx 838 GT

PRESS RELEASE 01/10 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs PRESS RELEASE 01/10 LIFEBOAT AND DAVIT MANUFACTURER FR. FASSMER AND LIFEBOAT LAUNCH SYSTEM SUPPLIER NADIRO ENTERS INTO COOPERATION AGREEMENT Danish company Nadiro A/S and German company Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co KG has signed cooperation agreement enabling customers to order Fassmer lifeboats with Nadiro’s Drop-In-Ball™ and full launching system including protecting container around the lifeboat which combines the Nadiro and Fassmer products. Esben Juul Sørensen, Managing Director of Nadiro, looks forward to the cooperation and expects to gain valuable knowledge and capture market shares from the cooperation: “Our customers expressed wish for us to partner up with experienced lifeboat manufacturer and therefore Fassmer the natural choice. Nadiro is newly founded company but the Drop-In-Ball™ and the enclosed launching system has received very positive attention from the industry. We consider cooperation with high quality lifeboat and davit manufacturer like Fassmer another blue stamp of Nadiro and possibility to grow further the future”. Fassmer already offers complete systems with their own Duplex® Release Hook which is conformity with the new regulations like DE 52 conventional hooks, however Fassmer Sales Manager Norbert Kotte, considers the agreement vital capturing potential changes the market: “We expect to see changes the industry due to new safety regulations and general demand for increased safety from seafarers. Even though we are very content with our current product portfolio, we always strive towards getting better and meeting new customer needs. If the Drop-In-Ball is the future, we want to be the game from the beginning” says Fassmer Sales Manager Norbert Kotte. Contact: Esben Juul Sørensen, Nadiro +45 61203808 or Norbert Kotte, Fassmer +49 4406 942-130 Nadiro is owned 80% by Danish A.P. Moller – Maersk Group and 20% by Danish SH Group and founded June 2009. Nadiro produces drop-in-ball™ system, replacing conventional lifeboat hooks and full solution covering the lifeboat on deck to increase safety. Fassmer is family owned German company founded 1850 with over 900 employees. Fassmer is working four main areas: Shipbuilding, Lifeboats/Davits, Access Systems and Fibreglass Technology. Fassmer has the experience and expertise it takes to guarantee maximum quality all phases of design, engineering and production.

PRESS RELEASE 03/10 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs PRESS RELEASE 03/10 New Survey Vessel for Fugro Delivery: 12 March 2010 Operator: Fugro Survey Ltd – Aberdeen Port of registry: Panama New Construction: 3050 The company Fassmer has delivered its latest new building, the first of two ordered 65 Survey Vessels for the FUGRO Group. The vessel is designed for geophysical research and survey with state of the art sounding and survey equipment world-wide operation. Fassmer and Fugro have taken this opportunity to look at all aspects of overall survey vessel design detail considering the latest equipment, making them the most advanced vessels of their type the world. The vessels operate the offshore oil and gas industry and the offshore renewable energy sector. They be able to carry out the full range of site and route survey tasks to obtain the high resolution data necessary for safe, efficient and cost-effective planning, design and engineering activities involving the seabed and the installation of pipelines, platforms, wind turbines, subsea structures etc. The FUGRO SEARCHER has maximum crew of 42 persons and can operate continuously 35 days at sea. The range of the vessel is 6000 nm at 10kn cruising speed. A maximum speed of 13.4 kn has been achieved at sea trails. For survey equipment the ship provides workdeck of 360 sqm free area with flush deck twist lock foundations. Modular seismic winches and equipment can be arranged on the workdeck within short mobilisation periodes. The propulsion system is of diesel electric concept with two ducted z-drive propellers and bowthruster. It is designed for station keeping work as well as towing seismic systems at low noise levels. The FUGRO SEARCHER hull is designed to minimize water noise for accurate research performance. To achieve this rotating machinery and pressurised loaded pipes are elastically supported. The bow shape is designed to minimize the appearance of air bubbles at the bow wave. The shape of the fore hull forces remaining air bubbles to the surface order to have steady water flow at the sounding gondola. The hull design has been CFD calculated and tested towing tank and the results were verified during seatrails with underwater camera and hydrophone tests. The accommodation area has berths for 42 persons double and single cabins. For survey and research work rooms for on line navigation, data processing, instrument room, office and two workshops are available. The social life on board take place the messroom with leisure area, recreation room with movie system and gymnasium.Due to the intensive noise reduction for water the inside noise levels are 5-10dB(A) lower than required by IMO. All cabins are fully air conditioned, have bathroom with shower and TV system. The below keel mounted gondola is approx. 12 length and hydrodynamically tested towing tank. It contains echosounders for multibeam, single beam and subbottom profiling. The work deck area contains knuckle boom crane 3 tons at 12 m, 7,5 Aframe, two 2.5 tons sliding booms and gravity corer launch system. FUGRO SEARCHER is designed to carry 75 tons of deck load which can be attached via the ISO twist lock system. Hydraulic, electric and seismic high pressure air power supplies are all available on the working deck. The high pressure air is produced by 4 water cooled compressors up to 200 bars for continuous operation of multi air guns and mini air gun parallel mode. At the seatrails the vessel outfitted and tested with multi air gun, streamer winch, mini-gun and mini streamer as well as with side scan sonar. All systems can be operated simultaneously. The marine and survey test and trials have been more than successful. Fassmer delivers this custom made vessel not only compliance with Fugro’s requirements but exactly on time. Technical Data of the Survey Vessel „FUGRO SEARCHER“ Main dimensions Length over all: 65,65 Width over all: 14,00 Design draft: 4,20 Displacement: 1851 Classification: GL+100 A5 “Survey Vessel” IW + MC AUT Performance Speed: 12,8 knots Max. Speed: 13,4 knots Range min.: 6000 nm Endurance, min.: 35 days Dead Weight Fuel oil: 253 Potable Water: 158 Complement: 42 persons Material Hull: Steel grade A Superstructure: Steel grade A Propulsion System Propulsion: 3 gensets each 1138 kVA Propulsion engine: 2 1100 kW Propeller: 2 ruderpropeller SRP1010, 2100mm, ducted Bowthruster: 400 kW Special Equipment The suite of survey equipment include EA600 single-beam echo sounder, EM302 and EM3002 multibeam echosounders, Edgetech dual frequency 4200 digital sidescan sonar, chirp sub-bottom profiler, Hydroscience SeeMUX digital system, with seismic source of up to 970cu firing into 3000 metre long solid digital streamer, and HiPAP 500 USBL system. The vessel be fully networked to provide full plug-and-play interconnectivity and have Fugro's dual DGPS high-precision Navigation systems. The design of the vessel permit simultaneous analogue/digital survey operations and AUV operations. Geotechnical and ROVSV duties can be undertaken. Diesel-electric drive, specially designed hull form, resilient engine mounts and rudder propellers maximise station keeping and navigational control while ensuring acoustically quiet running at survey speeds.

NEWS 02/11 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs Fassmer and NOREQ with cooperation agreement for production of the Torpedo lifeboat Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co. KG and Noreq As , Norwegian producer of maritime deck equipment agrees to further develop the Torpedo Free Fall lifeboat . Noreq has, since 2008 launched the Torpedo lifeboat as the evacuation method for the future for offshore use and it is fully equipped to meet the demands of tomorrow regarding rules and regulations for the North Sea. The cooperation agreement with Fassmer is confirmation of the interest the Torpedo lifeboat has drawn. Fr. Fassmer GmbH & Co is well-established corporation within the maritime industry. They have 900 employees and turnover of approx. € 100 mill. Fassmer is amongst the world’s largest fabricators of lifeboats for the cruise industry addition to traditional shipbuilding and high tech composite material production. The agreement secure good access to design-, development- and engineering capacities. The joint venture between Fassmer and Noreq is dedicated to the Torpedo Free Fall and are focusing on offshore projects both globally and for the North Sea. Increasing safety offshore In recent years the focus on the capabilities and features of free fall lifeboats offshore has drawn high attention. The Torpedo lifeboat is representing new and innovative alternative to ordinary free fall lifeboats. Its design and capabilities have been thoroughly tested at Marintek Norway and key features such as directional stability and reduced stress on onboard personnel have been recognized as safer and better alternative to traditional free fall systems. The cooperation between our two companies represents breakthrough for the Torpedo lifeboat and we are well positioned to take marked shares the offshore segment. With all the upgrading of free fall systems worldwide taken consideration, the market potential for the Torpedo is considerably high . Further information on Fr. Fassmer: www.fassmer.de Further information on Noreq AS: www.noreq.as Further information on the Torpedo Free Fall: www.noreq.no/eng/products/9/41/

NEWS 05/11 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 05/2011 Fassmer handed over Colombian Navy 40m Coastal Patrol Vessel (CPV40) On 9th of May, at 11:15 AM, Fassmer formally handed over the 40m Coast Patrol Vessel (CPV40) „ARC 11 de Noviembre“ to the Colombian Navy. The 40m Coastal Patrol Vessel contracted late December 2009 has already satisfactorily completed Sea Trials the North Sea on the 22nd of April. In such trials the vessel exceeded contractual performances speed, noise reduction and range; among other parameters. After two weeks of training and exercising the shipyard and at Sea the German Bight, the vessel handed over to the Navy. The handing over ceremony presided by the Colombian Ambassador Berlin Mrs Victoriana Mejia Marulanda and by the Head Of Plans of the Colombian Navy Vice Admiral Roberto Garcia Marquez. During the Ceremony the Colombian flag raised for the first time on the “ARC 11 de Noviembre” and the vessel officially incorporated to service. The first CPV40 is now on its maiden voyage heading to Cartagena, Colombia. Upon completing of the Atlantic crossing the vessel take over Coast Guard duties such as patrol and surveillance, smuggling interdiction, intelligence collection, SAR and maritime interdiction among other considered design. For further information about our CPV40 please click here .

News 07/11 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs News 07/11 Trauer Seniorchef: Nachruf Friedrich Faßmer Friedrich (Friedel) Faßmer , ehemaliger Geschäftsführer Fassmer-Werft, 28.06.2011 Alter 87 Jahren verstorben. Friedel Faßmer leitete 1964 1987 Bruder Heinz geschäftsführender Gesellschafter Unternehmen erheblichen Anteil Entwicklung unseres Unternehmens. Er 1987 Ruhestand, während Bruder Werft 1992 leitete. In Zeit Geschäftsführung Heinz Friedel Faßmer fiel Verlegung Betriebs binnendeichs außendeichs . Heinz Fassmer erinnert sich: „Das wichtiger Sprung für uns. Somit deutlich größere Boote gebaut werden.“ Die Karriere Friedel Fassmer begann Krieg Bootsbau-Lehrling Braue-Werft Bardenfleth. Als Marinesoldat geriet Nordnorwegen Kriegsgefangenschaft, August 1945 entlassen. Kurz Krieg Bootsbau-Meister , bevor Bremen Schiffbau studierte . Als Ingenieur arbeitete Friedel Fassmer Bremer Vulkan Lürssen-Werft. Anfang 60er Jahre stieg Betrieb Vaters Johannes, genannt Hans, ein. Dort arbeitete Bruder Heinz, ebenfalls Schiffbauingenieur war. Beide bildeten fortan Geschäftsführer-Team . Um Friedel Faßmer trauern Angehörigen Belegschaft unseres 160 Jahre alten Familienunternehmens .

NEWS 09/11 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 09/2011 Fassmer launches 28 m Fishing Research Vessel In August 2009 Fassmer awarded the contract to build 28 fishing research vessel as result of EU open invitation to tender organized by the Federal Office for Agriculture and Food. The contract value amounts to approx. 11.7 million €. On commissioning the new "CLUPEA", the old "CLUPEA" which has been operation for 60 years is to be replaced. The conceptual design for the new construction developed and prepared, by order of the Federal Office for Agriculture and Food (BLE), by the Shipping Technology Department (K4) of the Federal Office for Hydraulic Engineering (BAW), Hamburg Center, together with the future user, the Thünen Institute. The „CLUPEA“ be used the North Sea and the Baltic Sea. Its main area of operation be the Baltic Sea the waters around Rügen and its home port of Rostock. It be employed this area to examine the condition and changes marine ecosystems and fish stocks. This work serves to define admissible catch quantities, to research the influence of marine pollution on fish stocks, eco-toxicological assessment of cycles of matter and to record hydrographic data. One focus of work of this vessel be to develop environment-friendly and stock-friendly catching methods; the vessel has been equipped with state-of-the-art facilities for such work. Its size corresponds to the largest vessels used German coastal fishing. To identify the parameters required, the beam trawl, trawl nets, deep-sea nets, plankton nets, gillnets, hydrographic sensors and hydro-acoustic units are used. Design and construction planned by Fassmer close cooperation with the Shipping Technology Department (K4) of the Federal Office for Hydraulic Engineering (BAW) Hamburg. The new construction mainly be used by the Institute for Baltic Sea Fishing (OSF), at the Heinrich Thünen Institut (vTI) and is to be employed all year round as seagoing fishing research vessel. On average the ship be used for various objectives on around 300 days/year.

NEWS 11/11 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 11/2011 Fassmer handed over "Amrumbank" to the German Authority. On November 17 th Fassmer handed over “AMRUMBANK”, new 44.5-metre buoy-laying vessel , to the Water and Maritime Authority Tönning Wittdün on the German North Sea island of Amrum . The ship is the first of three new buoy-layers with length of about 44 metres. Fassmer commissioned to design and build after winning EU-wide invitation to tender. The two other buoy-layer are under construction with deliveries scheduled for the middle and end of 2012, respectively. The concept selected for "Amrumbank" features robust, flat displacement hull with excellent manoeuverability optimised by efficient voith schneider system. The main engine output limited to 2 375 kW max. for economic reasons . The specifications required for minimum speed of 11 kn and good stability for safe working at sea, crane operations. The hull and superstructure are made of steel , the bridge of seawater-resistant aluminium .

NEWS 01/12 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs ARC 20 de Julio on Seatrials, Dec 2011 (Courtesy ARC-COTECMAR) NEWS 01/2012 Chile and Colombia order additional Fassmer OPV80 On December 2011, both the Chilean and Colombian Navies have placed orders for additional Offshore Patrol Vessels of our successful OPV80 design. The Chilean Navy has already service two OPV80 ( OPV Piloto Pardo and OPV Comandante Toro ) and has plans to extend its fleet up to total of 5 OPVs. The excellent performance of the first batch, alongside its low operational cost, has been key factor the confirmation of the follow up vessels by the Navy. The construction of the third OPV take place at ASMAR shipyard Talcahuano, Chile, during 2012. In the case of the Colombian Navy, the confirmation of the Ministry of Defense to order the second OPV80 came just after successful testing of the first OPV ( ARC 20 de Julio ) the Caribbean Sea on December 2011. The Colombian Navy has plans to extend its OPV80 fleet to undisclosed number of units. The follow-up OPV is scheduled to start construction during the first semester of 2012 at COTECMAR shipyard Cartagena, Colombia. With these additional orders, there are total of 3 OPV80 service, 2 under construction and further 9 planned within 3 Navies, making Fassmer's OPV80 one of the most successful OPVs worldwide. We thank the Chilean and Colombian Navies for their confidence ordering additional ships of our design. For more information on Fassmer OPV80 please contact us at info@fassmer.de.

NEWS 02/12 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 02/2012 Fassmer baut Forschungsschiff Am 16.12.2011 Vertrag Alfred Wegener Institut für Polar- Meeresforschung (AWI) Firma Fassmer über Herstellung Lieferung 21 Forschungsschiffes unterschrieben . Mit Auftrag Serie Fassmer gebauten Forschungsschiffe komplettiert. Nach 65 langen Fugro Galaxy Fugro Searcher, 28 langen Fischereiforschungsschiff Clupea 40 langen Forschungsschiffes AWI-Schiff fünfte Forschungsschiff Folge. Das 21 Forschungsschiff wissenschaftlichen Aufgaben Wattenmeer östlich Sylt Röm durchführen sicher Seegebiet westlich Sylt Helgoland operieren können. Die Schiffsform Spantcharakteristik entspricht Wesentlichen mehrfach gebauten 21 Typ-Seezeichenmotorschiffes. Bei Typ-Schiffen handelt robusten, flachgehenden Verdrängerrumpf. Hinter Aufbauten freien Arbeitsdeck Forschungswinde Kran Heck-A-Galgen installiert. Ein klimatisiertes, kombiniertes Trocken- Nasslabor entsprechender Ausrüstung Deck Vorschiffsbereich angeordnet. Das Forschungsschiff geltenden Vorschriften Germanischer Lloyd Berufsgenossenschaft Verkehr gebaut. Neben Klassezusatzzeichen Environmental Passport (Green Passport) erhält Neubau Umweltzeichen "Blauer Engel Schiffsdesign" für Seeschiffe. Mit Umweltzeichen Design Bau Schiffes Innovationen Schutz Umwelt realisiert. Fassmer Herstellung Greenpeace Motorsegelschiffes "Rainbow Warrior" umfangreiche Erfahrungen Konstruktion Fertigung umweltfreundlicher Schiffe sammeln können darüber hinaus modernes Umweltmanagement-System Unternehmen implementiert.

NEWS 04/12 - Fassmer Shipbuilding Company Sitemap Imprint GTCs Contact Downloads Home | Business Areas | Company | News | Jobs Company Locations Facts Global Service Net Responsibility Office Contact News Press Releases Dates Jobs NEWS 04/2012 Flaggenwechsel neuem 36,5-Meter-Seenotkreuzer DGzRS für Station Sassnitz Auf großen, 36,5 Meter langen Seenotkreuzer Deutschen Gesellschaft Rettung Schiffbrüchiger (DGzRS) Flaggenwechsel erfolgt: Die Seenotretter jüngstes Flottenmitglied Freitag, 27. April 2012, Bauwerft Fr. Fassmer Berne-Motzen Unterweser übernommen. Die DGzRS überführt Schiff, derzeit internen Bezeichnung SK 32 versehen ist, Ostsee künftige Station Sassnitz, Laufe Tages erreicht soll. Im Zuge Modernsierung Rettungsflotte SK 32 Seenotkreuzer WIHELM KAISEN (Baujahr 1978) ersetzen. Die Taufe für Sonnabend, 26. Mai 2012, 15 Uhr, Sassnitzer Westhafen vorgesehen. Taufpatin Gattin Ministerpräsidenten Mecklenburg-Vorpommerns, Britta Sellering. Zu öffentlichen Taufe erwarten Seenotretter Ministerpräsidenten Erwin Sellering. Zuschauer herzlich willkommen. Voraussichtlich junge Dame Tochterboot taufen. Seit Zuwasserlassen Seenotkreuzers Mitte März stehen umfangreiche Erprobungen Schiffes „auf Herz Nieren“ Programm. SK 32 gesetzten Erwartungen umfassend erfüllt. In kommenden Wochen setzt DGzRS Erprobung Einrichtungen Systeme fort. Mit Bau großen Seenotkreuzers für Ostsee trägt Rettungswerk vorausschauend ansteigenden Verkehrsaufkommen See Rechnung. Nach einjähriger Vorplanung vergab DGzRS Sommer 2009 Auftrag Bau Ersatzfahrzeuges für WILHELM KAISEN. Entwurf, Modellversuche, Strukturauslegung, Erstellung Werkstattzeichnungen, Materialzuschnitt -verformung beschäftigten Werft Rettungswerk Jahr 2010 hinein. Die Kiellegung SK 32 erfolgte Dezember 2010. Der Neubau verfügt über leistungsstarke Feuerlöschanlage, Hubschrauberarbeitsdeck umfangreich ausgestattetes Bordhospital. Die völlig Schiffsklasse bewährten Netzspanten-Bauweise konstruiert. Die Eckdaten Seenotkreuzers: Länge über Alles: 36,45 Meter Breite über Alles: 8,20 Meter Tiefgang (50% Zuladung): 2,70 Meter Geschwindigkeit: 25 Knoten (ca. 46 km/h) Besatzung: 11/5 Pers. (Stamm/Einsatz) Antrieb: Maschinen Festpropeller 1160 kW/1578 PS – 2465 kW/3352 PS – 1160 kW/1578 PS, insgesamt 4785 kW/6508 PS Selbstverständlich Seenotkreuzer Tochterboot Selbstaufrichter konzipiert. Als Tochterboot erstmals Geschichte DGzRS gemeinsam Werft „Marine Specialised Technology Ltd.“ entwickeltes schnelles Festrumpfschlauchboot (Rigid Inflatable Boat/RIB) geschlossener Kajüte für Unterbringung Geretteten Durchführung Krankentransporten DGzRS-typischer Aluminiumbauweise Einsatz. Die Anforderungen Bereichen erreichbare Geschwindigkeit, Manövrierfähigkeit, erleichtertes Längsseitsgehen Kostenersparnis gegenüber bisherigen Tochterbooten vergleichbarer Sicherheit vollständig erfüllt. Die Eckdaten Tochterbootes: Länge über Alles: 8,90 Meter Max. Breite: 3,60 Meter Geschwindigkeit: 32 Knoten (ca. 59 km/h) Antrieb: Motoren Wasserjets 376 kW (ca. 512 PS) Wie Schiffe DGzRS gesamte Arbeit Neubau ausschließlich freiwillige Zuwendungen finanziert. Der Bau Schiffes Werft-Tagebuch Seenotretter online nachzuverfolgen: www.seenotretter.de/werfttagebuch
